title: Henry Mancini
summary: Henry Nicola Mancini (born Enrico Nicola Mancini; April 16, 1924 â€“ June 14, 1994)[1] was an American composer, conductor, arranger, pianist and flautist. Often cited as one of the greatest composers in the history of film,[2][3] he won four Academy Awards, a Golden Globe, and twenty Grammy Awards, plus a posthumous Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award in 1995.
